lines.content: * Bob program keeps track of the users ToDos, Events, Deadlines.
* Exits the program. Saves the task into a text file.
* Starts the program by loading current tasks and then receives input from uses.
* Receives input and sends to the parser for further processing.
* @return Whether Bob should still be active
throw new BobException("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* The {@code Parser} class interprets user input and translates it into commands that modify the {@code TaskList}.
* It validates the input format before performing actions like marking, unmarking, deleting tasks, or adding new tasks.
* Parses the input message for marking a task as done and applies the command to the given {@code TaskList}.
* @param message The input message to be parsed (e.g., "mark 1").
* @param t The {@code TaskList} where the task will be marked as done.
* @throws BobException If the message format is invalid.
public void markTaskParser(String message, TaskList t) throws BobException {
* Parses the input message for unmarking a task and applies the command to the given {@code TaskList}.
* @param message The input message to be parsed (e.g., "unmark 1").
* @param t The {@code TaskList} where the task will be unmarked.
* @throws BobException If the message format is invalid.
public void unmarkTaskParser(String message, TaskList t) throws BobException {
* Parses the input message for deleting a task and applies the command to the given {@code TaskList}.
* @param message The input message to be parsed (e.g., "delete 1").
* @param t The {@code TaskList} where the task will be deleted.
* @throws BobException If the message format is invalid.
public void deleteTaskParser(String message, TaskList t) throws BobException {
* Parses the input message for adding a ToDo task and applies the command to the given {@code TaskList}.
* @param message The input message to be parsed (e.g., "todo read book").
* @param t The {@code TaskList} where the ToDo task will be added.
* @throws BobException If the message format is invalid or the description is empty.
public void addToDoParser(String message, TaskList t) throws BobException {
throw new BobException("OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
* Parses the input message for adding a Deadline task and applies the command to the given {@code TaskList}.
* @param message The input message to be parsed (e.g., "deadline submit report /by 2024-12-31").
* @param t The {@code TaskList} where the Deadline task will be added.
* @throws BobException If the message format is invalid or the deadline description or end date is empty.
public void addDeadlineParser(String message, TaskList t) throws BobException {
throw new BobException("OOPS!!! The description/start time of a deadline cannot be empty.");
* Parses the input message for adding an Event task and applies the command to the given {@code TaskList}.
* @param message The input message to be parsed (e.g., "event project meeting /from 2024-09-01 /to 2024-09-03").
* @param t The {@code TaskList} where the Event task will be added.
* @throws BobException If the message format is invalid or the event description/start time/end time is empty.
public void addEventParser(String message, TaskList t) throws BobException {
throw new BobException("OOPS!!! The description/start time/end time of an event cannot be empty.");
public void findParser(String message, TaskList t) throws BobException {
throw new BobException("Text after find cannot be empty!");
* The {@code Storage} class handles the loading and saving of tasks to and from a file.
* It interacts with the {@code TaskList} and {@code Ui} classes to manage the tasks and provide feedback to the user.
// The file path where tasks are saved and loaded from
* Loads tasks from the specified file into the given {@code TaskList}.
* @param tl The {@code TaskList} where tasks will be loaded into.
// If the file is not found, simply do nothing
* Prepares the file for saving tasks by creating the necessary directories and clearing the file contents.
* If an error occurs during this process, an error message is displayed to the user.
fw.close(); // Clear the file contents by closing the newly created FileWriter
* Appends a task's string representation to the file.
* If an error occurs during this process, an error message is displayed to the user.
* @param s The string representation of the task to be saved.

* @return String to be output by Bob when listing.

* Keeps track of the event task that consist of description, start date, end date

* The {@code TaskList} class manages a list of tasks and provides methods to add, list, mark, unmark,
* and delete tasks. It also interacts with the UI and storage components to display and save tasks.
* Adds a task to the task list and updates the UI with the new task.
* @param t The task to be added.
* Lists all tasks currently in the task list. If the task list is empty,
* a message is sent to the UI indicating that there are no tasks.
* Marks a task as done based on its position in the task list.
* @param num The index of the task to be marked as done (0-based index).
* Unmarks a task as not done based on its position in the task list.
* @param num The index of the task to be unmarked as not done (0-based index).
* Deletes a task from the task list based on its position and updates the UI.
* @param num The index of the task to be deleted (0-based index).
* Creates a new ToDo task, adds it to the task list, and returns the created task.
* @param description The description of the ToDo task.
* Creates a new Deadline task, adds it to the task list, and returns the created task.
* @param description The description of the Deadline task.
* @param end The end date/time of the Deadline task.
public Task addDeadline(String description, String end) {
* Creates a new Event task, adds it to the task list, and returns the created task.
* @param description The description of the Event task.
* @param start The start date/time of the Event.
* @param end The end date/time of the Event.
public Task addEvent(String description, String start, String end) {
Task t = new Event(description, start, end);
* Saves all tasks in the task list to the provided storage.
* @param s The storage where tasks will be saved.
* The {@code ToDo} class represents a task that only has a description with no specific time associated with it.
* Constructs a new {@code ToDo} task with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the ToDo task.
* Returns a string representation of the ToDo task, including its type indicator "[T]".
* @return A string in the format "[T] description".
* Returns a string representation of the ToDo task formatted for saving to a file.
* @return A string in the format "T | isDone | description".
* The {@code Ui} class handles all interactions with the user. It provides methods to display
* various messages related to tasks and application events.
* Sends a message to the user by printing it to the console with a "[Bob]" prefix.
* @param message The message to be sent.
* Displays the introductory messages when the application starts.
sendMessage("What can I do for you?");
* Displays the exit message when the application is about to close.
sendMessage("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been added to the task list.
* @param t The task that was added.
* @param size The current size of the task list after adding the task.
public void addTaskUi(Task t, int size) {
sendMessage("Got it. I've added this task:");
sendMessage("Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been marked as done.
* @param t The task that was marked as done.
sendMessage("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been marked as not done.
* @param t The task that was marked as not done.
sendMessage("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been removed from the task list.
* @param t The task that was removed.
* @param size The current size of the task list after removing the task.
public void deleteTaskUi(Task t, int size) {
sendMessage("Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays a message indicating that an error occurred while trying to save tasks.
sendMessage("An error has occurred when trying to save.");

E | 1 | project meeting | from Mon 2pm | to 4pm
